definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: I go to cram schools to supplement my regular education.
sentences.chinese: 除了一般的教育之外，我還上補習班作爲輔助。

sentences.english: Weekends are spent sharpening academic weak spots in paid tutoring sessions.
sentences.chinese: 週末得花錢上補習班，提高自己學習中的薄弱環節。

sentences.english: He's been having remedial lessons and is now starting to read.
sentences.chinese: 他一直都在上補習班，現在已經開始閱讀。

sentences.english: The continuation class has already fulfilled its enrolment quota.
This research aims to explore the training effectiveness of air cram schools.
sentences.chinese: 本研究系針對航空補習班訓練成效進行研究。

sentences.english: Even if the cram schools are successful, there are still problems.
sentences.chinese: 即使這些補習班的事業斐然，仍然存在著一些問題。

sentences.english: However, your parents early on a winter vacation to make you a tutorial.
sentences.chinese: 但是，你的怙恃早早地給你報了寒假補習班。

sentences.english: A cram school teacher, holding a microphone, writes on the blackboard during a class.
sentences.chinese: 補習班教師上課時拿著麥克風講課，並於黑板上寫字。
這就是中國文化補習班的第二課。

sentences.english: He enhances his learning at cram school.
sentences.chinese: 他上補習班加強補習功課。

sentences.english: If you have failed a subject you need for graduation it is imperative that you go to summer school.
sentences.chinese: 假如你有一門功課不能畢業，你必須去上夏季補習班。

sentences.english: Xia spends her weekends, and her family's spare cash, attending tutoring sessions to help prepare her for the examination.
sentences.chinese: 她用家裏的餘錢參加週末的補習班，幫助自己備考。

definition: to take extra lessons in a cram school or with a private tutor
head of a household/family head/patriarch/parent or guardian of a child
to enter the next grade school
to go to school/to attend school
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
elementary school (Tw)/abbr. for 國民小學|国民小学[guo2 min2 xiao3 xue2]
the starting line (of a race)/scratch line (in a relay race)
